channel.title: Comments on: Book Review: The Fighting Styles of Kato Masao and Seo Bong Soo

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: I think the reason for the price hike on the printed version is that you are paying for analysis on two different players instead of just the one, but I also bought the Smartgo version and thought it was well worth the money as well. And I'm with you on feeling "3 stones stronger" after reading his books but then it magically disappearing when I'm actually playing a game. xD
item.content:encoded:
I think the reason for the price hike on the printed version is that you are paying for analysis on two different players instead of just the one, but I also bought the Smartgo version and thought it was well worth the money as well.
And I’m with you on feeling “3 stones stronger” after reading his books but then it magically disappearing when I’m actually playing a game. xD

item.title: By: Steven
item.dc:creator: Steven
item.description: I read "Master Play, The Style of Lee Chango" from Yuan Zhou. Yuan Zhou really has a way of making you understand the position without giving too much variations. Every time I read something from him I feel 3 stones stronger (I never was, but still: good feeling!) I would say the Smartgo price is reasonable, but I wouldn't pay 17.50 for a book version.
item.content:encoded:
I read “Master Play, The Style of Lee Chango” from Yuan Zhou. Yuan Zhou really has a way of making you understand the position without giving too much variations. Every time I read something from him I feel 3 stones stronger (I never was, but still: good feeling!)
I would say the Smartgo price is reasonable, but I wouldn’t pay 17.50 for a book version.
